intro: Trichocereus microspermus, commonly known as the "Little Seed Cereus," is a species of cactus native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces white, fragrant flowers that bloom at night, a common trait among many cacti in the Cactaceae family. Its stems are covered in sparse, short spines, and it is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
